div.head: Pollux traduzione
div.p: Pollux’s first book begins, as the lexicographer himself states at the end of the prefatory letter to Commodus (Praef. 1), with what concerns the gods, the divine, places of worship, priests and priestesses, the faithful, ceremonies, nouns and verbs related to cultual and ritual actions and instruments. The first author quoted by Pollux as an authority is Homer, for his use of the noun δαίμονες (‘daimones’) to call to the gods, followed by Plato, an author very dear to Pollux for both his Attic languange and his philosophical thought (see Zadorojnyi 2023).
